1.content:
Choose the character-

Bill Johnson- A CEO of a big company who is a chauvinistic womanizing guy who doesn't treat women correctly wakes up in the body of a meek female secretary who works for a man that was just like him.

Dante Adams- A high school student who thinks that the popular girls have life easier and plays pranks on them a lot. He wakes up in the body of a head cheerleader whose life isn't as easy as he thought.

Stephanie Grant- A hardcore feminist that thinks that men have life easier and get paid better than women. She wakes up in the body of a man who works for a domineering female boss who treats the man like shit and pays him a lot less than her.

Rebecca Ward- A popular girl who can have any boy she wants and treats others badly wakes up in the body of a clumsy nerd.
1.title: Reality Check

11.content:
You are dreaming of your day at work yesterday. You are telling your co workers that a woman should be seen not heard, you chew out your secretary for forgetting to print a page of a report and then you hear a loud beeping sound and you shoot awake. You feel different somehow. The room is dark so you get up and head for the bathroom.

"Ugh, I don't remember drinking this much last night, wait what's with my voice?" you say as you look in the mirror and see a young woman looking back. "HOLY SHIT! I'm a chick!" you scream.

You begin to panic and run around when you hear a phone ring. You run to pick it up. "Hello?" you ask.

"Listen up Sarah because I am only saying this once" an angry voice on the other line says. "I need those reports today,and you should wear a short skirt so I can see your pretty ass wiggle in it."

"Uh, yes sir" you say confused.

"See you at work" the voice says and hangs up.

111.content:
You don't know why, but you feel like you have to get ready for work. Now, you are noticing your new body more. You are a girl that's at least 25, with long brown hair, brown eyes, an attractive face, a decent build and slender arms and legs.

"Well, I probably should take a shower..." you say walking into the shower and turn the water on. You wash yourself, and notice that her soap smells like flowers. You finish the shower and walk out and brush and blow dry your hair, which the body seemed to take over for. You make your hair look nice and then go out to put on clothes. You see a business suit hanging in the closet, so you grab it and go into her drawer for a bra, panties and pantyhose. You put on the lingerie and then look at yourself in the mirror.

"This is weird" you say "I look kinda hot"

You continue getting ready, put makeup on and then the suit. You have trouble with the skirt because it is so short. Then you put the heels on, they were like 3 inches! This chick is nuts! You look at yourself in a mirror. If you were a guy, you would want to have sex with this girl, but now your thoughts are on how pretty you are, in a personal sense. But whatever, where the hell does she work? You check her phone and it has an address and name of the place. ThundCorp... weird name.

1111.content:
You find a pair of car keys, and walk outside the house. You see one of those Smart Cars. Jeez, those cars look like they could get torn through by a semi truck. Oh well, it's the only car you can use. You put the address into the GPS and start to drive. You can't help but notice that you feel smaller, almost weak and fragile. You brush it off and keep driving. You try to turn on the radio, but it looks like it's broken. You turn on the CD Player. Out of the speakers comes the most girly sounding song ever, you've never heard it before, but it's really catchy. You listen to the entire CD and then you are at her workplace.

You walk into the building, not used to the heels yet,but you manage to make it to the elevator. Her phone said that she worked on the 15th floor, so you click the button and wait. It stops on a floor and a man walks in. For some reason, you can't place, you feel weak and fragile again. The man turns to you, glaring.

"Sarah, did you finish the reports yet?" he says, instantly reminding you of who he is.

"Um, no sir, I just got here" you reply.

"Well, have it finished by the end of the day, got it?" he says.

"Yes, sir I will be sure of that"

"And good choice on the skirt" he says as the elevator beeps for 15 and you get off, you can feel him staring at your ass as you walk towards your cubicle. You see one that says Sarah Anderson, and inside there are pictures hanging up, one with an old man, an old woman, and the woman whose body you now inhabit. You assume that those are here parents and sit down. Now what to do?

You don't understand what it means but you see that it seems finished so you log into the email program and send it to the email address labelled boss. You hope that it was right and sit and wait for a reply.

1111211.content:
Time passes excruciatingly slowly.

You really have no idea how to do Sarah's job. Sure, you managed to find some allegedly “important” reports that you emailed to Sarah's boss … hopefully!

But that was blind luck.

You scarcely know how to walk in heels much less do Sarah's job.

For a long while you sit there, just staring at Sarah's computer screen and fidgeting with the hem of the short, tight skirt you're wearing.

Suddenly the phone rings.

Reflexively you pick up the receiver and answer: “ThundCorp, this is Sarah Anderson speaking. How may I direct your call?”

Weird.

Just a moment ago, you were hopelessly lost. Now at the sound of a bell, you're like one of Pavlov's dogs, conditioned to respond automatically in just the way Sarah's body is accustomed to doing so.

The caller is a gruff sounding man who treats you rather rudely and demands to speak with your boss.

“Yes, sir,” you chirp pleasantly. “I'll connect you with him immediately, sir.”

You deftly press a few buttons on your phone console and in no time flat have the call dutifully transferred to the boss.

Let him handle it, you think. He's a man and knows better anyhow.

Without even realizing what you're doing, you've bent down and picked up your purse. Removing a nail file, you begin to studiously work on your nails and wait for the clock to count down to lunchtime.

After a few more minutes have passed, the woman you had made a lunch date with earlier finally returns.

“You ready to go, Sarah?” she asks.

For a moment, you forget that she's talking to you. Weird, you think. A few moments ago, I was completely in “Sarah Mode,” thinking and acting like her.

“Uh, yeah, I'm ready,” you say, rising unsteadily to your wobbly feet. You might be able to answer a phone call as Sarah, but you still haven't mastered the art of walking in three inch heels.

Better get used to it if you're going to remain a woman!

“Where are we going?” you ask.

“Oh, I figured we'd go to the usual place,” says the strange woman.

Fat lot of help that is, you think to yourself. If you want any worthwhile clues about your new life, it appears you're going to have to try a lot harder than that.

You follow your new friend to the elevator, listening to her constant stream of gossipy chit-chat about various co-workers you haven't even met yet. Despite not recognizing any of the names, you feel easily drawn into listening to all the juicy little details of who got caught saying or doing what to whom!

Before you know it, the two of you are in the parking garage getting into the woman's car.

111121121.content:
Ouch, you're in an awkward spot right now.

Allison stares at you intently.

“What's going on today?” she repeats.

You blush and look down, fidgeting anxiously with the hem of your short skirt. Beneath the table, you kick off one of your shoes partially and nervously twirl your big toe about on it.

“Sarah, answer me,” presses Allison. “Something really weird is going on with you today. Now I want answers. Truthful ones. What's going on?”

“I'm not really Sarah Anderson,” you say softly.

“Excuse me?” asks Allison.

“I'm not Sarah,” you say, slightly louder this time. “This isn't actually my body. I'm an imposter – trapped in Sarah's body. But I'm not really her, and I actually don't know anything about her or her life.”

“You're kidding me,” deadpans Allison.

You shake your head somberly.

“Okay, let's play along with this,” replies Allison, still not quite believing her ears. “Uh … so you're not my friend and co-worker Sarah. That just begs the question: who the hell are you?”

“My name is Bill Johnson,” you answer. “I'm the CEO of IntrepiCorp, Ltd.”

“And how did you end up in my friend Sarah's body?” asks Allison.

You shrug your shoulders.

“You just woke up in Sarah's body this morning and have no idea how it happened?” Allison asks skeptically.

“Yes,” you answer. “I swear, this is all the honest truth. I don't know how this happened. I'd love to get my own body back. You think I like going from being the boss to being a secretary?”

“Not just a secretary, but Mr. Horndog's personal plaything!” laughs Allison.

“What?” you say, gulping nervously.

“You really aren't Sarah, are you?” says Allison, more seriously this time. “Oh my god. I don't know why – but I believe you. This is crazy! Things like this just don't happen in real life. But it's the only explanation. You're not Sarah. You're … uh … I'm sorry, I forgot your name already?”

“Bill Johnson,” you say meekly.

“Yes, Bill Johnson,” she repeats. “Well, perhaps you and I better keep that our little secret, eh? Sarah is a ditzy dingbat, but so far she doesn't have a reputation for outright insanity. I'd hate to see my best friend get locked up in an insane asylum for running about claiming she's a man.”

“You're going to help me?” you ask shyly.

“What are friends for?” smiles Allison. “We should probably check in with your life at some point and find out if the real Sarah is now trapped in your old body. Maybe she has an idea of what happened … and how this can be undone. Or, I'm sorry – did you want to remain a girl from now on?”

Is she serious, you think in horror.

You vigorously shake your head no.

“It's not all bad, you know,” says Allison. “I'd hate for you to steal my friend's body without her permission. But if Sarah did this deliberately, maybe she wants to remain a man. In that case, you might have to get used to wearing skirts and pantyhose everyday.”

You sigh and struggle to hold back a flood of tears. Damn, these female hormones messing with your emotions already!

“Hey calm down,” Allison says. “We won't know anything until we find your old body and see whether or not Sarah's spirit wound up inside it. In the meantime, you and I are best friends. I've got your back, okay? Just listen to good old Allison – I'll help guide you through work and the rest of Sarah's life. You just have to promise me that you'll be a good custodian of Sarah's body until we find out if she did this on purpose or not. That means no getting yourself tattooed or knocked-up or anything like that yet, okay?”

The suggestion of you getting pregnant is too much, and the floodgates suddenly open. Before you know it, tears are streaming down your cheeks and you're softly sobbing on Allison's shoulder.

“There there,” she says. “Calm down, and just let Allison help take care of everything.”

You suspect there's precious little Allison can do, though, to alter the fact that you're now a woman and could theoretically get yourself pregnant. You don't want Sarah's life, her body, her clothes, her job, and all the problems that come with living inside her skin for the rest of your days!

12.content:
Dante Adams woke up expecting to find a ratty-haired blonde in his arms, the girl he took home from the previous night's homecoming party, but the bed was empty. This itself wasn't surprising. It had been a lousy night.

She couldn't stop prattling while straddling him about cosplaying as Yana-Yugo-San or some-such nonsense at an anime convention; all the while, Dante kept his ear peeled for the garage door in case his parents had lied and weren't staying the night with friends. He threw in the obligatory grunt here and there, whispered "I love you's" and "Oh yeah's" but his heart wasn't in it and he figured the girl knew. She was just happy some football player had paid attention to her.

He rubbed the sleep out of his eyes. The ceiling was the same slate-gray as his own, but everything else seemed different... The bed was closer to the ground, the sunlight came from another angle, the covers felt thinner and the corner pulled across his shoulder was decorated with green-and-brown bamboo sticks. His had been plain, and he was sure the nerd girl hadn't brought her own blanket...

A poster on the wall caught his attention. "MARTYR OF THE RUCKUS," bold, faux-3D letters declared beneath a photo of sleazy, scowling men in leather and dreads. They were the big pop-band of that year, geared mostly toward popular girls who wanted to feel "rebellious." All the cheerleaders loved them. Dante's thoughts began to race at the association until, spotting family photos featuring a certain brunette, his mind seized the impossible. He clutched his head and felt a thicker mane of hair, and in the motion several strands fell before his eyes - brown, not blonde and close-cropped.

The covers flew off and Dante discovered the damp camisole plastered to his new rack of epic proportions: breasts he only dreamed of, now two inches from his vision. Green boxer shorts cut off at his thighs and revealed tan, vibrant legs, no doubt as muscular as his old ones, but more compact in their power and capable of a grace beyond the limits of his old broad-shouldered, 6'3'' body. Bare feet with pink-pig toes wiggled at the edge of this smaller bed. They taunted him with the new reality.

14.content:
Rebecca Ward enjoyed the best night's sleep she'd ever had in her sixteen-year old life.

She'd dreamed it was senior year of high school already, and she had been elected Prom Queen, finally fulfilling what she knew had always been her just role in school. All the boys were clamoring for her attention, but only the hunkiest and hottest could be her date, of course. All the girls had been put firmly in their places: either as ladies-in-waiting to run errands for Rebecca and laugh at all her snide jokes, or cast off into the outer circle of losers and social misfits deemed unsuitable to interact with the rest of teenage society.

Yes, what a wonderful dream, thought Rebecca as she yawned and stretched in the golden, warm rays of the early morning sunlight streaming through her window.

“Wait a minute,” she grumbled to herself. “I hate morning sunlight!”

She'd insisted her parents put up expensive, extra-thick curtains to block the light from disturbing her beauty sleep. What was going on?

Irritated, Rebecca sat upright in bed, fully prepared to fight with the drapes to get them closed. Mom and dad would get an earful about this at breakfast, of course! They'd promised her these window treatments were the best, and yet here she was being awoken by rotten old blinding sunlight when …

Rebecca abruptly stopped her mental tirade in order to blink her eyes a few times in amazement.

“This isn't my bedroom,” she said flatly.

The room was a cluttered, claustrophobic mess of drab colored, dirty piles of clothes. Paperback books were stacked waist-high along one wall. A bookshelf nearby stood filled, not with books but with a bewildering array of plastic model spaceships and little toy action figures of robots, aliens, and comic book heroes. The walls were plastered with badly hung, cockeyed posters ripped out of cheap, glossy magazines. Rebecca, who normally had perfect vision, couldn't quite make out the pictures depicted in the posters.

“Why is it so blurry?” she said.

Then she noticed her voice.

It wasn't her voice.

It was a squeaky yet low-pitched voice. Almost like the voice of a … a boy?!

Immediately, Rebecca leaped out of bed and started examining herself.

Her worst fears were confirmed: she was in the chubby, pale skinned body of a sixteen-year old boy right now!

She was currently shirtless, and could see her flabby yet flat-chested, male torso clearly displayed. Whoever's body this was, the poor schlub clearly never worked out! Around her legs was a pair of flannel pajama pants. Lifting the front waistband of the pajamas, Rebecca peered down and sighed in disgust at the sight of her own flaccid penis, just hanging there limply.

“I've become some pathetic loser,” she said, still staring in horror at her small yet undeniably masculine sign of manhood.

Groping around a bit, Rebecca managed to find a sweatshirt to pull on. Next came a pair of glasses with mind-bogglingly thick lenses and unflatteringly unfashionable cheap, plastic frames. They allowed her to see much better though, and she was finally able to complete a visual survey of the tiny bedroom she now occupied.

Unsurprisingly, the posters on the walls all depicted various stupid sci-fi movies and television shows Rebecca was unfamiliar with. Likewise, the stacks of paperback novels all had dumb science fiction or fantasy titles on them. She didn't see a copy of the Hunger Games, 50 Shades of Gray, or one of the Twilight books anywhere! Clearly this geek had no taste in literature!

“Who the hell am I?” she wondered aloud.

On cue, an obnoxiously nasal voice called out from somewhere else in the house: “Ronald, darling sweety-pie, are you awake yet my little pumpkin?”

“Oh … my … gawd,” Rebecca said, trying to fight a rising tide of panic within her. “I'm that clumsy, fat nerd kid from school – Ronald Dwebble.”

His tiny body was shivering.

Ronald had always been a bit pudgy – husky, his mother called him. But he'd never been small or light enough to shiver from a simple cool, morning breeze in the early air. Something had happened to the small ridge of fat he usually had padding and protecting his body from a chill.

Bolting upright in bed, Ronald blinked his eyes to full alert status.

“My spidey sense is definitely tingling,” he said to no one in particular.

His voice was all wrong. But that could wait. At the moment, Ronald was more immediately consumed by the fact that his bedroom was even more wrong!

Everything was pink and girly (not to mention neat and tidy!)

And Ronald himself was laying under some expensive looking, pink and white satin sheets in a big, plush bed that was for more comfy than the one he was accustomed to.

“I'm not me anymore,” he said simply. “And this isn't my bedroom. What, oh just what, is going on here?”

Calmly, Ronald climbed out of bed and began to examine his own body.

“Confirmed,” he said to himself, looking down at a pair of perky, firm breasts and creamy, smooth skin clad beneath a skimpy, white negligee with lace trim. “This is most definitely not my body.”

He began walking around the room, searching for clues to his identity. Passing a wall-mounted mirror, Ronald caught a glimpse of reflection and actually stood still, genuinely surprised.

“Rebecca Ward?” he said, a bit shocked. “Of all the people in the world, I somehow … I mean, I really switched bodies with Rebecca?”

Long a fan of science fiction and fantasy books, films, and television, Ronald had found it easy to swallow that something incredible had happened to him: he had magically swapped bodies with another person. But what Ronald wasn't prepared for was that the person he had switched with would be the gorgeously beautiful yet shallow and superficial Rebecca Ward – the same person Ronald had secretly harbored an unrequited crush on since grade school … and the same person who had always treated him with nothing but cruel, mean-spirited contempt.

Tearing his eyes away from his angelic new reflection in the mirror, Ronald picked up the phone and answered.

“Hello?” he said.

“You miserable toad!” came the familiar voice of an angry, teenage boy. “You stole my body. I want it back right now, or else!”

“Excuse me?” Ronald said, actually confused for a moment about who would be so angry with him. “Oh, wait – is this Rebecca Ward?”

“Of course I'm Rebecca!” she shouted with Ronald's voice. “You think you can steal my body and leave me trapped as a fat nerd? Oh, I'm going to make your life so miserable …”

“Calm down,” Ronald said. “I didn't do this on purpose. In fact, I don't think I did anything at all to cause this. It's as big a surprise to me as it seems to be to you. Believe me, I'd love to get back to my own body.”

“What are you talking about?” said Rebecca. She found it inconceivable that Ronald didn't want to remain in her body. She was beautiful, popular, and spoiled rotten by her rich parents. Ronald had to have done this on purpose. He was jealous of her and had wanted to steal her life … right?

“I said I didn't do this,” Ronald repeated calmly. “And if you'd like, I think we should cooperate and work together to find a way of reversing this.”

“You actually want to go back to your fat, loser nerd body?” Rebecca asked incredulously.

“Uh, yeah,” Ronald said. “I guess I do. Look, you're very pretty Rebecca … but … well, I don't really want to be a girl.”

Ronald laughed nervously.

“Well,” said Ronald. “In episode seventy-nine of Star Trek, Janice Lester uses an alien life-energy transfer procedure to steal Captain Kirk's body, and …”

Which believe me, I'd love to be able to do. But some things are simply in the realm of science fiction rather than …”

Moving as quietly as he could muster, Ronald rose and tiptoed away from Jenna and Mindy. A brief walk around to the other side of the building would do him good, giving him a chance to compose himself before entering the school from a different entryway.

1441111112221.content:
“Hi!” Ronald said, leaning across the aisle between desks in the classroom. “My name's … Rebecca. You're new here, right?”

Ronald internally winced at having to introduce himself as Rebecca. But it wouldn't make sense to go around calling himself by a boy's name now.

“I'm Alyssa,” said the girl, a drab nervous-looking mousy girl. “Yeah, my family just moved here. It's nice to meet you.”

“Have you met anyone else here yet?” Ronald asked.

“No,” Alyssa said quietly. “You're the first person who has taken the time to say hello to me. Everyone at this school is either really busy or …”

Alyssa trailed off, leaving the unspoken line lingering silently in the back of Ronald's mind: “Or just a bunch of stuck up snobs?”

Ronald smiled as prettily as he could, trying to remember that he was a girl right now.

“We're not all like that,” he answered. “I know some of the kids here aren't very nice. But some of us are … well, some of us aren't what we seem.”

Although Ronald knew he needed to rendezvous with the real Rebecca at some point today and compare notes, it wasn't a discussion he was looking forward to having. So, he decided to throw caution to the wind.

“Alyssa, would you like to come over to my house after school?” he said. “I think we could be pretty good friends. I'm sure my folks would love to have you stay for dinner.”

“Sure, thanks!” Alyssa said happily. “It's a relief to finally have someone to talk to around here.”

“You don't know the half of it,” Ronald grinned.

144111111222121.content:
Ronald easily muddled his way through the rest of the school day. Other than catching a few snide comments from Rebecca's meaner friends directed at his lack of fashion sense, the day seemed to progress remarkably well. Ronald was confident that he'd performed very well on a few tests he'd had to take in Rebecca's classes. She'd thank him later, he was sure, for helping raise her grades.

At the end of the day, Ronald found Alyssa waiting for him at his new locker.

“Hi, Rebecca!” Alyssa said with a shy smile. “Did you still want to hang out after school?”

“Sure thing,” Ronald said with a bashful smile. Despite the fact that he was in the body of the hottest, most popular girl in school, Ronald still found himself attracted to the female gender. And there was something about this shy, unassuming new girl that Ronald found very attractive. If only he was still a guy, perhaps he'd try to work up the courage to ask her out even?

Ah, who was he kidding. Ronald was a nervous basket-case around girls. He'd never asked out anyone on a date yet.

But now that Ronald was a girl, it felt like the pressure of was. He could relax and be himself around someone like Alyssa. It would be fun to actually get to know her. Maybe they could be best friends?

“So I've heard a lot about you,” Alyssa said.

“Oh?” Ronald replied carefully. Tugging nervously at his skirt, he started to grow nervous. If Rebecca's reputation had preceded him, maybe a shy, smart girl like Alyssa would want nothing to do with him.

“Yeah. Everyone here knows you,” Alyssa said, with a bit of reverent awe. “I hear you're a cheerleader? And everyone loves the big parties you throw at your house. You've dated tons of really super cute guys. And all the really popular girls with the In Crowd here all claim to be your best friend.”

“Well, I don't know about all that …” Ronald said cautiously.

“Rebecca, don't get me wrong,” Alyssa said. “I'm very flattered that you're being so nice to me. And I really do have a good feeling about you. I think we could be good friends. But I just have to ask: you're not just pretending to be nice to me as some kind of prank or mean joke? I know it sounds crazy, but things like that have really happened to me before, at my old school. I'm accustomed to being a social outcast and a reclusive loner. Nobody like you has ever wanted to be my friend before.”

“Alyssa, I swear to you,” Ronald said solemnly. “I am not playing any jokes on you. I really want you and I to be friends. And as for my reputation … well, let's just say the other kids are probably exaggerating. I'm really not as popular as you might think. A lot of what you heard is old history. I'm a different person now from who I once was.”

“But you're still a cheerleader?” Alyssa said, clearly impressed with Ronald's perceived social standing.

Ronald had to reluctantly admit to himself that yes, as long as he inhabited Rebecca's body, he was in fact a cheerleader. Sooner or later he'd be wearing a tiny skirt and prancing around in front of crowds of screaming fans. It wasn't something he was particularly looking forward to!

“Uh, yeah, I'm a cheerleader,” Ronald said. “But I'm a lot of other things, too.”

“Wow, I could never be a cheerleader,” Alyssa said, a touch of hero-worship creeping into her voice. “I'm so clumsy! I really envy you Rebecca. You've got the perfect life. You're awful pretty. And yet, you're such a nice girl. I think I'm actually going to enjoy living in this town.”

Ronald and Alyssa were really hitting it off nicely by the time they reached Rebecca's home.

My home now, Ronald glumly reminded himself.

And when they do notice me, it's only because they want to make fun of me. Can you help me, please?

If he ever got back to his own body, why would Alyssa ever want to go out with him?

144111112.content:
Ronald watched in stunned silence as Edith and Penelope walked away from him, laughing cruelly. Sure, he'd always known Edith had a mean streak to her sarcastic, biting sense of humor. But Ronald had always enjoyed being lab partners in chemistry class with the quirky, eccentric girl. Until today, she'd always seemed funny, friendly, and nice in a offbeat, kooky kind of way.

As Ronald watched Edith and Penelope head towards the school's main entrance, he spied them encountering Jenna and Mindy – two popular girl flunkies of Rebecca Ward. The duo ranked just one notch below Rebecca herself in the school's pecking order and basically served as sycophantic lackeys to the teenage beauty queen whose body Ronald now inhabited.

This morning Ronald watched with mixed emotions as Jenna surreptitiously slipped out her foot in front of Edith's path, causing the short, chubby girl to go crashing down into the hard pavement. As Edith picked herself up from the ground, now sporting a scraped knee and a purplish-yellow bruise on her thigh, Jenna and Mindy laughed themselves silly at the nerd girl's pain and humiliation.

Ronald quietly approached the kerfuffle, hoping to overhear everything without being seen and getting drawn into the row.

“Yeah, because physical violence is not only really mature, but it's hilarious too!” Edith spat at Jenna. “Where'd you pick up your highly refined sense of sophisticated humor, Jenna? Was it watching reruns of The Three Stooges or just zoning out in front of old Tom & Jerry cartoons?”

“Shut up, you dumb nerd,” laughed Jenna, twirling a strand of her long, straight blond hair. “You're not only like weird, but fat and all nerdy too, and I don't know why you, like, dye your hair 'cuz you're totally not trendy and your hair is so ugh, so like why don't you just go build a model space ship with your loser Trekkie friends and stuff and don't even bother trying with hair and make up.”

“Oh my God,” said Edith rolling her eyes. “Was that bit of verbal diarrhea all just one single, gigantic run-on sentence?”

“Edith, come on,” whispered Penelope nervously. “Let's just go!”

“No. Wait,” insisted Edith. “I want to hear more monosyllabic insults from this troglodytic trollop. Please, entertain us again with your rapier sharp wit, Jenna.”

“Huh?” asked Jenna.

“Wit,” said Edith slowly. “It means humor: banter, whimsy, badinage, drollery, satire, rapartee. Am I speaking your language yet, you neanderthal nitwit?”

“I'm proud I don't speak your stupid nerd language!” retorted Jenna. “I don't need to understand you in order to know you're just a loser.”

“You didn't understand me again?” replied Edith. “I'm sorry. Neanderthal means Caveman. I guess you haven't heard the latest Katy Perry song: 'Paleoanthropology of the Late Pleistocene.' She explains all about the displacement of mousterian culture by the aurignacian, but in a pop song. Oh, it's very catchy! Or maybe a lower primate like yourself prefers the Justin Bieber cover, because I'm pretty sure he did a version of that song, too. I'll bet philistines like you and Mindy just love Justin Bieber.”

“Shut up you stupid loser!” snapped Jenna. “Gawd Edith, you're such a bitch just cuz you're jealous of us for being popular, and having boyfriends, and being on the cheerleader squad.”

“Oh, yes!” beamed Edith sarcastically. “I'm secretly dying to trade away my ability to do long division in exchange for a polyester skirt riding up my thigh. Because you're so right: my life would just be pure bliss if only I could be an illiterate icon of ignorance and indiscriminate promiscuity … just like you, Mindy, and that vapid Paris Hilton imposter you both slavishly take orders from.”

“I swear to god, I'm going to kick your ass you stupid fat nerd freak!” growled Jenna.

“I see,” Edith said calmly. “And your threat of brute violence makes a clever rejoinder to my comparing you to a primitive, prehistoric dullard because why … ?”

14411112.content:
The real Rebecca Ward was just then huffing and puffing, struggling to make her way up to the school. Trapped under the heavy, blubbery weight of Ronald's chubby out of shape body, Rebecca had worked up quite a sweat in her rush to get to school. Thick, wet armpit stains dripped down the sides of her size XXL t-shirt – a faded yellow garment with the words “Particle Physics gives me a hadron” spread out across the front in yellow print. Rebecca didn't get the joke, but the shirt was one of the only clean looking things she could find to wear in Ronald's bedroom.

Pushing her glasses back up the sides of her greasy, oily nose, Rebecca spotted her old body in the distance.

Oh no, she thought. It looked like Ronald was talking to those two obnoxious weird girls: Penelope and Edith. Please don't spoil my reputation by hanging with the likes of them, she thought.

Rebecca hurried up, waddling as fast as her clumsy, corpulent body could muster.

As she approached her old body, Rebecca could see the weird geek girls disengaging with disgust from discussion with her old body and now walking straight towards her.

“Hey Ronald!” Penelope said warmly, while batting her eyes.

Oh dear god, Rebecca thought with horror. This beanpole goth wannabe has a crush on me now! Ewww.

“Hey,” Rebecca muttered back in reply, still focused on reaching Ronald in her old body.

“You checking out the queen of mean?” laughed Edith, gesturing backwards at Ronald in Rebecca's body. “The princess of pain, duchess of depravity, our demonic La Belle Dame sans Merci?”

“Huh?” said Rebecca. She didn't get what Edith was saying, but she knew it wasn't complimentary.

“Becky Ward turned over a new leaf,” explained Penelope, still blushing and giggling when she spoke to Rebecca in Ronald's body. “That's why she's dressed like that.”

Rebecca burned with rage gazing at the mismatched array of clothing Ronald had clad her beautiful body in.

“Rebecca's wardrobe comes courtesy of Goodwill and the K-Mart Corporation,” said Edith in a dramatic stage whisper.

“I'll kill him,” hissed Rebecca angrily.

Penelope grinned with delight, and Edith actually giggled.

“You're going to murder the president of the society for the historical reenactment of the movie Clueless?” gasped Edith in mock horror. “Better get in line, Ronald. Half the school wants to see that promiscuous tart get finally get her comeuppance. The day she dies the murder suspects will include every girl who lost a boyfriend to her, the pallbearers will be comprised of the entire football team, and the coffin will have to be shaped like the letter Y.”

Penelope burst into snorts of laughter. Rebecca frowned, still not getting it yet recognizing she was the butt of the joke.

“Don't let her get under you skin, Ronald,” said Edith. “In a few short years, we'll all be college graduates and poor little Rebecca Ward will be spritzing perfume in the cosmetics aisle of some discount department store, slaving away for minimum wage.”

Rebecca fumed silently in Ronald's bloated, sweaty body. Furious, she stomped away from the nerd girls and went to confront the slimy toad currently ruining her life.

“Uh, good morning,” Ronald said to her with a weak smile. He tugged nervously at the fabric of his long, pink skirt. “I see you, uh, got to school all right today.”

“What the hell did you do to my body?” demanded Rebecca. “How can you go out in public dressed like that? Even the nerdettes are making fun of you!”

“Yeah, I know,” Ronald said glumly, staring down awkwardly at his new breasts. “I really tried hard to be nice to them. Usually I get along okay with Edith and Penelope, but today …”

“Listen you stupid, fat blob of grease,” Rebecca said, shaking her own chubby finger at the thin, beautiful body that once belonged to her. “As long as you're me, you are NOT friends with those two lame misfits! And another thing: after school today, I'm going home with you and I'm going to hand select your outfits for the rest of the week. Plus, I'm laying down some other laws. No going outside without makeup – and that nasty lipstick stain ring around your mouth right now does not count as a makeup, by the way. And you're learning how to style hair tonight, too. No arguments!”

“Wait a minute, Rebecca,” interrupted Ronald. “I'm doing the best I can, and …”

“Don't call me 'Rebecca' any more, you slimy toad,” hissed Rebecca with an angry whisper. “You're Rebecca Ward now. Geesh! Start acting like it. You've got a reputation to maintain. You can't go around acting like a happy, dumb nerd boy anymore. Get a clue!”

“Okay, fine,” said Ronald, frowning and trying to collect his thoughts. Everything he'd done this morning had turned out wrong. Maybe he should start following Rebecca's advice. “You're Ronald and I'm Rebecca. I promise I'll try to behave more like you.”

“Good,” snapped Rebecca. “Now your locker is # 327. I wrote down the combination for you on this scrap of paper. Here's your class schedule too. Don't be a brainiac in class! You're me now, okay? So just sit quiet, look bored, and if a teacher asks you anything just say, 'I don't know.' But don't be a nerd in my body, please!”

“I'll try,” said Ronald. “Thanks for all this. I guess I should write down your locker number, combination, and class schedule too. That was very thoughtful of Reb- … I mean, Ronald.”

“Don't be nice,” hissed Rebecca. “This isn't second grade Sunday School. You don't have to say please and thank you all the time. Sheesh! Act like I would.”

“In that case,” said Ronald thoughtfully. “Maybe we shouldn't be talking. I probably shouldn't be seen associating with you, uh, 'Ronald.' I hope you understand?”

“That's the first smart thing you've done yet,” grumbled Rebecca. “I'll see you after school. Don't forget: you're Rebecca Ward now.”
14411112.title: The real Rebecca arrives

144111121.content:
Ronald managed to find and open Rebecca's locker without major incident. Glancing down at his schedule, he saw the first class of the day would be Remedial General Science.

Ronald groaned. He was a science whiz! He should be in Intermediate Chemistry this year, not Remedial General Science. And as per Rebecca's orders, he was supposed to sit quietly in glance and pretend to be a brain-dead bimbo. The indignity of it all!

“Hey, girlfriend!” chirped a friendly voice from the locker on the left. “Rebecca, you look terrible. What's wrong, girlfriend? Do you need to talk?”

Ronald looked up and lost his breath gazing closely into the sweet, soulful eyes of Emily Butler. Her soft brown eyes showed genuine care and concern as she smiled sympathetically at Ronald. Standing so close to Emily, Ronald was intoxicated by the ambrosial fragrance of her perfume.

“I'm, uh, I'm just not myself today,” Ronald stuttered, clumsily dropping his book bag and spilling textbooks all over the floor of the hallway.

“Let me help,” Emily said supportively. “What's going on, girlfriend? Your hair is a mess, your clothes are all yuck, and your makeup … uh … the less said about that, the better.”

“I'm just not me right now,” Ronald repeated, feeling apprehensive and twitchy being in such close proximity to one of Rebecca's beautiful best friends.

“Rebecca, you can't go to class looking like this,” Emily said, bending over and whispering in Ronald's ear.

The sensation of her warm breath in his ear and on the side of his neck sent shivers of delight down Ronald's spine.

“Let's skip class,” Emily suggested. “I'll give you a total makeover, and you can tell me all your troubles. Unburden yourself, girlfriend! What are BFFs for, right?”

Ronald had never skipped class in his life. In fact, he'd never even stayed home from school while genuinely ill before. His attendance record was spotlessly perfect … up until this point in time. And he had to admit, it was very seductive, the thought of cutting class to spend some close, intimate time with a beautiful girl who wanted to run her fingers through his hair and touch his face and body (even if all Emily was interested in was primping and beautifying Ronald).

And maybe Ronald even could unburden himself to Emily? The real Rebecca was proving to be mean, nasty, and downright unpleasant about their current role reversal. Emily on the other hand seemed warm and sympathetic. Perhaps Ronald could explain what had happened? Maybe Emily would even have an idea to help switch Ronald and Rebecca back to normal?

Ronald fidgeted silently, staring at the glossy polish on the tips of his fingernails. Should he skip school and go with Emily … or should he scamper off to class like a good, responsible student?

144112211.content:
“Ronald, dear?” said a soft, feminine voice from behind.

Rebecca jumped, startled by the sudden intrusion of a stranger into her new bedroom. She breathed a sigh of relief when she caught sight of the plump, middle aged woman who, she surmised, must be her new mother.

“Oh, hello,” Rebecca said, forcing a smile. “You just surprised me.”

“My, you're a bit of a surprise yourself this morning, honey,” said Ronald's mother with a proud smile. She looked up and down Rebecca, admiring the choice of attire Rebecca had effortlessly selected and clothed herself in. “You're already dressed for school, and I must say your appearance looks so neat and tidy for a change. I'm really proud of you, sweetie. You clean up so nicely when you want to. Maybe you'll be asking a girl out on a date today at school?”

Rebecca tried not to burst out laughing at the thought of fat, nerdy, shy Ronald Dwebble asking out a girl.

“My little man is growing up,” said Ronald's mother. “I'm sorry to embarrass you, honey. It's just that I'm so thrilled to see you finally coming out of your shell.”

Rebecca felt a pang of guilt. She didn't really know Ronald, but she could somehow still empathize with a mother who wanted to see her son happy. She must know what a loser he is, but nevertheless she hopes and prays he'll find a way to fit in and be happy.

And she probably has no idea just how cruel Rebecca and the other popular kids at school have been to her little boy over the years.

144112211111121112122121.content:
As Rebecca finally rounded the last corner of her long trudge back to Ronald Dwebble's house, she saw a familiar figure in the distance standing out on the front lawn waiting.

It was the tall, thin silhouette of Penelope. She had changed clothes and was now wearing a dark burgundy dress and a pair of matching flats. Her long, limp hair had actually been done up about the back of her head and neck in an attractive, sweeping style.

Part of Rebecca thought, what a geek! This is obviously her first date ever, and I've been on like dozens of dates with dozens of guys way hotter than Ronald Dwebble. What a pathetic loser.

But a different part of Rebecca's mind was going through a metamorphosis … not exactly part of the magical transformation that had resulted in her disgusting, fat, male body. Rather it was more of a transformation of personal growth.

Just the one day Rebecca had spent struggling to live the lonely life of a social outcast in high school was already teaching her something about sympathy for others … and something about empathy for a sad little lonely geek girl who'd never been asked out on a date before, and now stood here nervously worrying and dreaming about how her very first date would go.

Rebecca had the power to be a selfish jerk here.

But Rebecca also had the power to do something truly selfless. She could go on this date with Penelope and try to make the poor girl's first ever date a memorable, magical experience.

And for the first time in her life, Rebecca thought doing something nice for someone else – with no expectation of reward – was the right thing to do. Rebecca Ward, the Ice Princess, felt her heart melt with pity and affection for this poor girl's hopes and dreams.

“I can't believe I'm really going to do this,” she whispered to herself, as she approached her blushing, fidgety date.

“Hi, Ronald!” beamed Penelope.

The poor girl was practically bursting at the seams with excitement.

“Penelope, you look beautiful,” Rebecca said, taking Penelope's right hand and gently kissing it. “I've really been looking forward to seeing you all day. Let's go somewhere nice. I thought dinner and a movie, followed by a walk in the park at sunset. I promise, it'll be a good restaurant though. Nothing cheap.”

“Oh, anything is fine!” giggled Penelope. Her face was shining with radiant delight.

Rebecca smiled, feeling a bit of enjoyment at bringing a ray of light into this girl's normally dim and dull world.

“No. We need to go someplace special,” said Rebecca. “After all, you're a very special person to me, Penelope.”

Penelope gazed with adoration in Rebecca's eyes. The girl was blinking rapidly, struggling not to cry tears of joy over how romantic and gentlemanly her secret crush was behaving.

Only two days ago, that very same boy – Mike Farlen – had asked Rebecca out on a date. She'd kept the handsome hunk dangling, refusing to commit to anything. Rebecca had always enjoyed teasing and toying with all the boys who were constantly asking her out.

Now she was getting bullied them!

While bashfully averting his eyes, Ronald stripped out of the skimpy negligee and panties Rebecca had worn to bed last night. He then groped about in her underwear drawer (a prospect that normally would both aroused and embarrassed him) before pulling out a pair of lime green cotton granny panties from the far back of the drawer. These would be the best to wear, he thought

Pulling the panties up onto his smooth, soft legs, Ronald tugged to get them properly fitted to cover his large, curvy, round hips and behind.

Next, Ronald pulled out a random bra from Rebecca's dresser. He wasn't sure it was important to match the bra with the panties, but figured such things were fairly trivial. He struggled for a few moments with the stiff, lacy purple garment, but finally managed to get it securely fitted over his firm, perky breasts.

That's weird, thought Ronald gazing down at his feminine chest. He'd always thought the role of a bra was to restrain and secure a woman's breasts. And yet with the bra on, Ronald's new female assets seemed even bigger and more jiggle than before. Somehow this garment was padded or something to enhance the size of Ronald's boobs and even make his cleavage more pronounced than ever. He had to admit, it was a pleasing sight – one that would have pleased him far more had he still been a teenage boy! But he now felt himself hoping Rebecca wouldn't be angry with him for choosing a bra that drew too much attention to her former breasts.

“Clearly, there's a lot I still need to learn about women and their clothing,” Ronald said aloud to himself.
Still bashfully worrying and fretting over his breasts, Ronald opted to dress himself in modest, reserved clothing. As a boy, Ronald had been a simple t-shirts and jeans kind of guy. So he dug through Rebecca's clothes hoping to find something similar. He managed to find a plain, light gray t-shirt made of some soft, girlish fabric. He put it on, but chose not to pair it with jeans. Everything Rebecca owned seemed too tight and revealing – skinny jeans, joggings, leggings, and super short shorts.
Exasperated, Ronald finally gave up and put on the longest skirt he could find in Rebecca's closet: a dark pink garment that came down to mid-calf on his new body.
The skirt left him feeling cold, drafty, and exposed around the legs though.

So Ronald found a pair of opaque, hot pink tights and worked them up onto his feet and legs. He then found a pair of black and white, Converse Chuck Taylors and put them on.

“Good enough,” Ronald said to himself, finally checking out his reflection in the mirror.

The girl in the mirror, however, looked all wrong.

“What am I not doing right?” Ronald wondered.

He grabbed a pink, button down cardigan sweater and slid his arms into it. Did that help? Not really. Maybe he needed to do something with his hair? Ronald hurriedly brushed his long, golden blonde locks, slicked it all straight back, and tied it into a loosely limp ponytail. Still not right! Maybe he needed makeup? Girls like Rebecca were always wearing makeup. Timidly, Ronald reached for a random tube of lipstick and began smearing his lips with a coat of bright, bold, ruby red gloss. Again, back to the mirror – again, still not right!

“Oh, I give up!” Ronald said in exasperation. “This will just have to be close enough.”

Ronald made sure to grab Rebecca's school bag full of books before heading out the door. He definitely didn't want to embarrass her by forgetting to bring her homework or study materials for class.

Unlike Ronald himself, Rebecca owned her own car – a sporty little red convertible. So while Rebecca was trudging to school on foot in Ronald's body right now, Ronald got to enjoy the new experience of driving himself to school. He made absolutely certain not to speed or do anything foolish. He didn't want Rebecca getting a ticket.
Arriving at the high school's parking lot, Ronald got out of the car and had to adjust his tights and skirt a bit, in a most unladylike fashion. At the other end of the parking lot, Ronald spotted two other teens – a pair of social misfits named Edith and Penelope. As a guy, Ronald had enjoyed a passing acquaintance with the two. He was lab partners with Edith again this year, and he and Penelope were in the audiovisual club together and had done some behind-the-scenes tech work on sound and lighting for school plays.

Ronald wasn't exactly friends with either girl, but had enough of a casual association with both to say hello in the school halls.
Now disguised in the body of popular Rebecca Ward, Ronald skipped up to Edith and Penelope and greeted the pair.

“Hi, guys!” he chirped in Rebecca's voice.

Edith and Penelope stopped dead in their tracks, staring long and hard at Ronald without speaking.

Penelope, a tall skinny girl with a pale complexion made worse by her choice of all black clothing, forced herself to smile politely and nod quietly at Ronald.

Edith, a short chubby girl with thick glasses and hair dyed an unnatural neon green girl, stared with her jaw dropped wide for a moment.

“What the hell is wrong with you today, Li'l Miss Prom Queen?” Edith asked. “Since when do you deign to grace the dregs of high school society outcasts with your stylish presence?”

Penelope said nothing but quietly began to giggle.

Ronald blushed with embarrassment.

“Look, I'm sorry if I haven't been that nice to you in the past,” he said. “But bygones are bygones, right? I just thought …”

“You? Thought?” laughed Edith. “That's one for the history books, Penelope! Our pretty pink cheerleader princess here just had her very first thought. Stop the presses! Rebecca Ward's brain develops a thought – details during the 11 o'clock news.”

“Okay, I probably deserved that,” admitted Ronald ruefully. Normally, he rather enjoyed chemistry class with Edith's caustic, biting sense of humor constantly aimed at the popular kids in class. This morning though, it was all directed right at him. “But now, I'm … uh … I'm turning over a new leaf and trying to be a new person. I'm sorry about everything that I've done in the past. I hope you and Penelope can forgive me. I assure you, I really am a changed ma- ... a changed girl. I'm a whole new person now!”

“Good for you,” Penelope said quietly, still struggling not to giggle.

“Is that why you let a pack of hyperactive, color-blind, four year olds dress you this morning?” asked Edith. “Sheesh, at least the old you had style – vapid, shallow, superficial style … but style nonetheless. What are you now: the Ugly Betty Barbie Doll? Ooo, I love your makeup Rebecca! Tell me: is it maybelline or lipstick by the Joker?”

“Edith, come on. Let's just go,” giggled Penelope.

“No way,” said Edith. “This Lindsey Lohan wannabe here has made our lives an absolutely miserable living hell since middle school. And now she suddenly has a change of heart and wants to play friendly? What happened – did your little bimbo friends all desert you, and now you have no one to be snooty and arrogant with? Or were you visited last night by the ghostly spirits of prom queens past, present, and future and given visions of why you must change your simpleminded, superficial ways? Is that why you want to play at this little game of Let's Patronize the Freaks and Geeks?”

“Sorry about her,” Penelope said, still struggling not to snort with uncontrollable laughter. “We like the new you, Rebecca. We really do!”

Penelope now forcibly dragged her shorter friend away, leaving a stunned Ronald standing alone in the parking lot, scratching his head and wondering what he had done wrong. A brilliant but friendly nerd like himself in the body of a beautiful, popular girl – he should have the best of both worlds right now!

When he finally relented, he was mad that they were going to be late because she was taking forever getting ready.

"You just don't understand how hard it is to be a woman!" Lana shouted. "I can't just throw on an old shirt with a stain on it and just go!"

"Complain, complain, complain is all you do! It can't be that hard!" Jackson shouted back.

The fight went on, they said some things they'd both regret, and she was gone. But this morning, Jackson's doorbell had rung. He had hoped it was Lana, ready to make up, but instead it was a shoe box. He picked up the box and opened it, revealing a pair of....
1552321.title: A Mile in her Heels

15523211.content:
Revealing... black pumps, the type that Lana would wear to work at the office. Jackson set the box down on the table and stared at it. He grabbed one of the heels and looked inside of it, then inside the box.

"No note from Lana... Maybe a friend borrowed these from her and don't know about the living situation yet? Or..." Jackson continued to think.

He absentmindedly kicked off his socks and continued thinking. He tried calling Lana, but no answer, same as it was for the last few days.

As he mused, he almost didn't notice himself pick up one of the shoes again and start to slip it onto his foot. He probably wouldn't have noticed, but it fit!

"What the?" he asked. "Why are these in my size?"

He looked down at his foot again. It seemed... almost smaller? He compared both his feet, and sure enough, the one without the heel on was bigger.

"What if..." he started, before morbid curiosity got the best of him. He quickly put the other heel onto his other foot. He wiggled his toes, which tingled as the shoes snugly encased his feet. "Okay, that's enough."

He started to take off the shoe, but found that it was stuck to his foot. He started to panic.

"Get off!" he shouted, as he pulled, to no avail.

He stood up and started walking across the room to the kitchen to get a knife, but on the way he stumbled and fell backwards. He braced himself to hit the floor, but was surprised that he kept falling as his vision faded to black.
15523211.title: A secretary's black pumps

155232111.content:
Jackson awoke in a cold sweat. The alarm was blaring and he reached over and hit the snooze button. As the alarm stopped, he heard a strange tapping sound as he fumbled to turn the alarm off entirely.

Jackson yawned and stretched as he pulled himself upright, noticing that he felt strange... and didn't remember getting into bed the previous night. He felt a tickling on his shoulders and noticed that his vision was framed by long blonde hair.

"Ahh!" Jackson screamed, though it wasn't his voice.

He jumped out of bed and looked around the room. Something clicked in his head.

"This isn't my room!" he shouted. "This isn't my voice!"

He fumbled around for a light switch and found one, turning on the lights. He looked around his surroundings.

The room was a light lavender, and the pillows and sheets on the bed matched. The room had a bed, a dresser with a TV sitting on top of it, and a small pile of DVDs, a closet, and a vanity with a mirror. Jackson looked down at his body, noticing that it was much smaller, and he was wearing a black nightgown. Not only that, but he had breasts, which he grabbed at, before grabbing at his crotch, finding that part of his anatomy had been replaced.

"No, no, no!" he sighed as he put his hands over his face.

His fingernails were longer and had a french tip design, and his toes were perfectly pedicured and matched the design of his fingernails.

Jackson walked over to the vanity and looked into the mirror, seeing a blonde woman. She didn't look like him, and definitely didn't look like Lana.

"Who am I?" Jackson asked.

Suddenly, the door to the room was thrown open and another woman, looking similar in age to whoever Jackson was now, poked her head in.

"Come on! We're gonna be late!" she shouted.

"...Late?" Jackson asked.

Just as he started thinking about who this woman was or what was going on, his mind was suddenly flooded with memories. This was Sarah, his best friend and roommate, and they both worked at the same office.

"For work." Sarah said. "Unless you don't want the ride..."

"Oh! Uh... I'll be ready in a little bit." Jackson said.

Sarah shut the door, leaving Jackson alone to...

“What if…” he started, before morbid curiosity got the best of him. He wiggled his toes and the sneakers somehow felt comfortable….”Ok that is enough” he shouted out loud!
He wanted to get out of the shoes but somehow his feet were stuck…He started to panic and shouted again…

info.brief_description: Some people think that others have an easier life.  Be careful what you wish for...
info.description: Have you ever been treated badly by someone? Did you ever want them to walk a mile in your shoes? That's what happened here, Four people treat others badly and then have to live their life for an indeterminate amount of time.
